page.title: 16Old St Mary's Church, Walmer
page.content: Old St Mary's Church (circa 1120) was owned by the{d'Auberville}family and was the Parish Church. The Church was enlarged twice, in 1816 and again in 1826, but was restored to the original size in{1897}after a new church was built to house the large congregation in 1888. The{tower}of the old church was added to the new and a pinnacle with a bell made by{Joseph Hatch}was erected in its place. The oldest tombstone in the 3.5 acre graveyard belonged to{John Basset,}a Gunner of Walmer Castle who died in 1680. An immense{yew tree,}still standing near to the Church Porch, is probably as old as the Church. On one stained glass window,{St Elizabeth of Hungary is pictured giving food to the poor. One day she met her husband and the meal in her lap turned to roses. There is a{font}dating from 1664.
